data.content_preview:
# Development Teams

## Overview

The Development Teams are the technical engine of Hypernet, responsible for building and maintaining the personal data infrastructure platform that powers AI agents. These teams design, develop, test, and deploy all product features, integrations, APIs, and infrastructure components. Development Teams transform the product vision into reality, ensuring security, scalability, performance, and an exceptional developer experience.

## Role and Responsibilities

### Product Development
- Build and maintain the Hypernet API platform (REST, GraphQL, Webhooks)
- Develop data models for 30+ data types (email, calendar, social, media, financial, health, etc.)
- Create and maintain 100+ data source integrations (Google, Apple, Microsoft, Meta, etc.)
- Implement user-facing applications (web dashboard, mobile apps, developer portal)
- Develop AI-powered features (semantic search, insights, personal AI agents)

### Platform Engineering
- Design and evolve system architecture (monolith → modular → microservices → platform)
- Build scalable infrastructure supporting 1K → 10K → 100K → 500K+ users
- Implement caching, CDN, database optimization, and performance improvements
- Create developer tools, SDKs (Python, JavaScript, Go), and API documentation
- Build internal tools for operations, monitoring, and developer productivity

### Security and Privacy
- Implement authentication and authorization (JWT, OAuth, SAML, SSO)
- Design privacy-first architecture with user consent and data control
- Build encryption (in-transit, at-rest), optional end-to-end encryption, and zero-knowledge options
- Conduct security audits, penetration testing, and vulnerability management
- Achieve compliance certifications (SOC 2 Type II, ISO 27001, GDPR, CCPA)

### Quality and Reliability
- Write automated tests (unit, integration, end-to-end) with 85%+ coverage target
- Implement monitoring, logging, alerting, and observability
- Maintain uptime SLAs (99.5% → 99.9% → 99.95% → 99.99%)
- Optimize API latency (p95: <500ms → <200ms → <100ms → <50ms)
- Conduct load testing and prepare for traffic spikes

### Developer Experience
- Create comprehensive API documentation with examples and tutorials
- Build developer portal with API key management and usage analytics
- Provide SDKs, code samples, and integration templates
- Offer technical support through documentation, community, and direct channels
- Gather developer feedback and iterate on API design

### Data Operations
- Build data ingestion pipelines for importing user data from 100+ sources
- Implement data normalization, transformation, and quality validation
- Create data export and portability tools
- Design data retention and deletion policies
- Build anomaly detection and data integrity monitoring

## Planned Positions and Roles

### Phase 1: Private Beta (Mar-May 2026, Team: 8-12)

**CTO** (Hired Month 4, Apr 2026)
- Technical leadership and architecture decisions
- Hire and build engineering team
- Own product roadmap execution
- Partner integration technical leadership
- Reports to: CEO

**Senior Backend Engineers (2-3)** (Current + Month 4-5 hires)
- Core API development (FastAPI, Python)
- Database design and optimization (PostgreSQL)
- Authentication and authorization systems
- Integration framework development
- Reports to: CTO

**Full-Stack Engineers (2-3)** (Month 4-6)
- User dashboard and web applications (React, TypeScript)
- Developer portal and documentation site
- Frontend for onboarding and settings
- API playground and testing tools
- Reports to: CTO

**Integration Engineers (1-2)** (Month 5-6)
- Build data source integrations (OAuth flows, API clients)
- Maintain integration health and monitoring
- Update integrations when APIs change
- Document integration specifications
- Reports to: CTO or Senior Backend Engineer

**DevOps Engineer (1)** (Month 5-6)
- Infrastructure as code (Terraform, AWS)
- CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Jenkins)
- Monitoring and alerting (Datadog, PagerDuty)
- Database administration and backups
- Reports to: CTO

### Phase 2: Public Beta (Jun-Dec 2026, Team: 20-30)

**VP of Engineering** (Month 7-9)
- Manage engineering team and hiring
- Engineering processes and best practices
- Team productivity and performance
- Cross-functional collaboration with Product, Design
- Reports to: CTO

**Engineering Manager - Platform** (Month 8-10)
- Lead platform engineering team (5-8 engineers)
- Infrastructure, scalability, performance
- Developer tools and internal systems
- Reports to: VP Engineering

**Engineering Manager - Integrations** (Month 9-12)
- Lead integrations team (4-6 engineers)
- Integration roadmap execution (50+ integrations by Phase 2)
- Partnership technical support
- Reports to: VP Engineering

**Frontend Engineers (3-5)** (Month 7-12)
- Web application features and improvements
- Mobile app development (React Native or native)
- Design system implementation
- User experience optimization
- Reports to: Engineering Manager or VP Engineering

**Backend Engineers (5-8)** (Month 7-12)
- API feature development
- Data processing and storage
- Background job systems (Celery)
- Performance optimization
- Reports to: Engineering Manager - Platform

**QA/Test Engineers (2-3)** (Month 10-12)
- Test automation and framework development
- Manual testing for critical features
- Quality assurance processes
- Bug tracking and triage
- Reports to: VP Engineering

**Security Engineer (1)** (Month 10-12)
- Security architecture review
- Vulnerability scanning and remediation
- SOC 2 audit preparation
- Incident response planning
- Reports to: VP Engineering or CTO

**Product Managers (2-3)** (Month 6-12)
- Product roadmap and feature prioritization
- User research and feedback analysis
- Work with engineering on specs and requirements
- Cross-functional coordination
- Reports to: VP Product (if hired) or CTO

### Phase 3: Growth (2027, Team: 60-100)

**VP of Product** (Q2 2027)
- Product strategy and vision
- Lead product management team (4-6 PMs)
- User research and analytics
- Competitive analysis
- Reports to: CEO or CTO

**Principal Engineers (2-3)** (Q1-Q3 2027)
- Technical leadership and architecture
- Mentor senior engineers
- Drive major technical initiatives
- Code quality and best practices
- Reports to: CTO or VP Engineering

**Engineering Managers (4-6 total)** (Q1-Q4 2027)
- Platform, Integrations, Mobile, AI/ML, Data, Security teams
- Team sizes: 5-10 engineers per team
- Reports to: VP Engineering

**Mobile Engineers (4-6)** (Q2-Q4 2027)
- Native iOS app (SwiftUI)
- Native Android app (Kotlin)
- On-device processing features
- Mobile SDK development
- Reports to: Engineering Manager - Mobile

**ML/AI Engineers (3-5)** (Q2-Q4 2027)
- AI-powered features (semantic search, insights, recommendations)
- Personal AI agent framework
- LLM integration and optimization
- Model training and deployment
- Reports to: Engineering Manager - AI/ML

**Data Engineers (3-5)** (Q3-Q4 2027)
- Data pipeline optimization
- Analytics infrastructure
- Data warehouse (Snowflake, BigQuery)
- ETL and data quality
- Reports to: Engineering Manager - Data

**Security Team (3-5)** (Q3-Q4 2027)
- Expand security engineering capacity
- SOC 2 maintenance and ISO 27001 pursuit
- Penetration testing and bug bounty
- Security operations center (SOC)
- Reports to: Engineering Manager - Security or Chief Security Officer

**Design Team (3-5)** (Q1-Q3 2027)
- Product designers
- UX researchers
- Design systems
- Brand and marketing design
- Reports to: VP Product or Head of Design

### Phase 4: Market Leadership (2028, Team: 150-250)

**Chief Technology Officer (CTO)** (Continues)
- Overall technical strategy and innovation
- Engineering organization leadership (80-120 engineers)
- Technical partnerships and integrations
- Technology M&A evaluation
- Reports to: CEO

**VP of Engineering** (Continues + potential for multiple VPs)
- May split into VP Engineering - Product and VP Engineering - Platform/Infrastructure
- Manage engineering managers and teams
- Scale engineering organization globally

**Engineering Directors (3-5)** (H1-H2 2028)
- Director of Platform Engineering
- Director of Product Engineering
- Director of Mobile & Client
- Director of AI/ML
- Director of Data Engineering
- Reports to: VP Engineering

**Senior Engineering Managers (10-15)** (Throughout 2028)
- Manage teams of 8-12 engineers each
- Specialized teams: API, Integrations, Mobile iOS, Mobile Android, AI, Data, Security, DevOps, QA, etc.
- Reports to: Directors or VP Engineering

**Engineering Teams (80-120 total engineers)**
- Backend Engineers: 25-35
- Frontend Engineers: 15-20
- Mobile Engineers: 10-15
- Integration Engineers: 8-12
- DevOps/SRE Engineers: 8-10
- AI/ML Engineers: 8-12
- Data Engineers: 8-10
- Security Engineers: 6-8
- QA Engineers: 6-8

**Product Management (8-12 PMs)**
- Consumer product team
- Enterprise product team
- Platform and developer experience team
- AI and innovation team
- Reports to: VP Product or CPO

**Design Team (8-12)**
- Product designers
- UX researchers
- Content designers
- Design systems engineers
- Reports to: Head of Design or VP Product

## Hiring Timeline and Fundraising Phases

### Phase 1: Private Beta (Mar-May 2026)
- **Funding:** Seed round, self-funded
- **Hires:** CTO (Month 4), 2-3 engineers, 1 integration specialist, 1 DevOps
- **Total Engineering Team:** 8-12 people
- **Focus:** Ship private beta, build first 20 integrations, developer portal

### Phase 2: Public Beta (Jun-Dec 2026)
- **Funding:** Series Seed ($20M)
- **Hires:** VP Engineering, 2 EMs, 15-20 engineers, 2-3 PMs, 2 QA, 1 security
- **Total Team:** 20-30 people (engineering + product + design)
- **Focus:** Public launch, 50+ integrations, mobile apps, enterprise features

### Phase 3: Growth (2027)
- **Funding:** Series A ($50M)
- **Hires:** VP Product, 4-6 EMs, Principal Engineers, 40-60 engineers across all teams
- **Total Team:** 60-100 people
- **Focus
